title: Parallel connection of cables
fullText:
Cables with conductors of cross-section less than 10 mm2 shall not be connected in parallel.
NOTES:
1	The current-carrying capacity of cables connected in parallel is the sum of the current ratings of all parallel conductors, provided that the cables have equal impedance, cross-section and rated conductor temperatures.
2	See the recommendation in IEC 60092-352 relating to special precautions for single-core cables for a.c. wiring.
